summary: This is an email chain between federal prosecutors discussing case staffing and strategy. It references the 'Epstein/Rikers stuff' as a competing workload and mentions reviewing email returns, financials, and a potential 'covid scheme' or 'PPE scam' in another case. The primary focus appears to be a case referred to as 'wbtw' and 'Ukrainians', with a secondary note about the time commitment of the Epstein case.

persons.name: Ann
persons.context: Email participant discussing case strategy, staffing, and workload, noting that 'Epstein/Rikers stuff' has been taking up their time.

connections.description: Ann suggests adding M to the case team, indicating they work in the same office or unit.

events.title: Case Strategy Discussion
events.description: Prosecutors discuss staffing, reviewing evidence (emails, financials), and planning for a potential superseding indictment in the 'Ukrainians' case.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The email is internal correspondence between federal prosecutors in the Southern District of New York.
It reveals that the 'Epstein/Rikers stuff' was an active, time-consuming matter for the prosecutors as of June 2020.
The primary subject of the email is a different case (referred to as 'wbtw' and involving a 'possible PPE scam'), showing the competing priorities in the office.
The prosecutors discuss adding staff (specifically 'M') to handle email review and move a case closer to charging.
The document provides insight into the operational workload and staffing discussions within the U.S. Attorney's Office.
